articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations said Israeli tanks had burst into its base in southern Lebanon on Sunday, the latest accusation of Israeli violations against peacekeeping forces, as Hezbollah unleashed a deadly "swarm of drones" on an Israeli military camp.
articles.title: UN says Israeli tanks burst into peacekeeper base, while Hezbollah drones kill four

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council on Monday expressed strong concern after several U.N. peacekeeping positions in southern Lebanon came under fire amid clashes between the Israeli military and Iran-backed Hezbollah militants.
articles.title: UN Security Council backs Lebanon peacekeepers after Israeli attacks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine denied late on Monday media reports that it has been involved in supplying drones to rebels fighting in the north of Mali.
articles.title: Ukraine denies involvement in drone supplies to Mali's rebels

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, Sakshi Dayal, Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Earlier in the day, India said it had ordered the expulsion of six high-ranking Canadian diplomats and withdrawn its envoy from Canada.
articles.title: Canada expels top India diplomats, links them to murder of Sikh leader

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's military started a new round of war games near Taiwan on Monday, saying it was a warning to the "separatist acts of Taiwan independence forces", and offered no date for when they may conclude.
articles.title: China starts new round of war games near Taiwan, offers no end date

articles.author: Simon Johnson, Mark John
articles.description: Three U.S.-based academics won the 2024 Nobel economics prize on Monday for their research into why global inequality persists, especially in countries dogged by corruption and dictatorship.
articles.title: Nobel economics prize goes to inequality researchers Acemoglu, Johnson and Robinson

articles.author: Will Dunham
articles.description: NASA launched a spacecraft from Florida on Monday on a mission to examine whether Jupiter's moon Europa has conditions suitable to support life, with a focus on the large subsurface ocean believed to be lurking beneath its thick outer shell of ice.
articles.title: NASA launches spacecraft to gauge if Jupiter's moon Europa can host life

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lawmakers in Mexico's lower house of Congress voted on Monday to approve legislation to implement a controversial judicial overhaul that will move the country to a system of judges elected by popular vote.
articles.title: Mexico's lower house lawmakers pass bill to implement judicial reform in lopsided vote

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Jack Kim
articles.description: North Korea is getting ready to blow up roads that cross the heavily militarised border with South Korea, Seoul said on Monday, amid an escalating war of words after the North accused its rival of sending drones over its capital Pyongyang.
articles.title: North Korea set to blow up cross-border roads with South amid drone row, Seoul says

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Police arrested more than 200 pro-Palestinian demonstrators who had staged a sit-in outside the New York Stock Exchange on Monday to demand an end to U.S. support for Israel's war in Gaza, authorities said.
articles.title: Dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters arrested outside New York Stock Exchange
